entry.title: Author Aaron van Wirdum Appointed Bitcoin Magazine Editor In Chief
entry.summary:
Bitcoin Magazine is excited to announce that veteran reporter and author Aaron van Wirdum has been named Editor in Chief, a position he formerly held from 2021 to 2022. The appointment follows his sabbatical in 2020 to write â€œThe Genesis Book: The Story of the People and Projects That Inspired Bitcoin,â€ released by Bitcoin Magazine Books in 2024.
Known for reporting on Bitcoin privacy, scalability, Core releases, and more since 2013, van Wirdum brings a wealth of experience and expertise to Bitcoin Magazineâ€™s editorial room. A pioneer in the space, van Wirdum is the industryâ€™s preeminent technical reporter. â€œBitcoin Magazine has always been a leader in Bitcoin technical reporting. Iâ€™m excited to work with a strong staff of industry veterans to continue this tradition,â€ van Wirdum said. â€œBitcoin is a technology that will continue to improve and advance, and I believe Bitcoin Magazine can play a key role in facilitating this necessary dialogue with the community.â€ Van Wirdum will be leading the editorial team in producing high-quality, insightful content revolving around the most important topics of discussion in Bitcoin, as well as resuming a leading role in publishing its quarterly magazine, which reaches thousands of subscribers. His deep understanding of Bitcoinâ€™s technical and economic aspects will undoubtedly enhance the publicationâ€™s coverage and analysis, providing readers with reliable and informative content. â€œAaron van Wirdum has long defined Bitcoin Magazineâ€™s editorial product and ethos,â€ said Mike Germano, President and Publisher of Bitcoin Magazine. â€œWe look forward to having him lead our staff at a time when presidents, senators, and celebrities are joining our readershipâ€™s ranks.â€ For editorial submissions or comments, Aaron can be reached via email at aaron@btcmedia.org.

entry.title: Marathon Digital Holdings To Raise $250 Million To Buy More Bitcoin
entry.summary:
Marathon Digital Holdings, one of the US's largest publicly traded Bitcoin miners, announced plans to raise $250 million through a private offering of convertible senior notes. The funds will be used primarily to expand Marathon's Bitcoin holdings.
BREAKING: ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ MARATHON DIGITAL HOLDINGS TO RAISE $250 MILLION TO BUY MORE #BITCOIN pic.twitter.com/6NKbfyDPvh â€” Bitcoin Magazine (@BitcoinMagazine) August 12, 2024
The Nevada-based company operates a fleet of miners, producing around 579 bitcoins in July. Marathon's balance sheet contains over 20,000 Bitcoin worth over $1.1 billion. Earlier in July, Marathon bought $100 million worth of Bitcoin on the open market as part of its long-term "hodl" strategy. The company said it will hold all newly mined Bitcoin as reserves. This latest move to raise capital for direct Bitcoin purchases mirrors the strategy pioneered by MicroStrategy. Since 2020, MicroStrategy has issued debt and sold shares to accumulate more than 220000 Bitcoin in corporate treasury.Â Marathon aims to position itself atop the nascent but rapidly evolving Bitcoin mining and services industry by aggressively expanding its Bitcoin stack.Â This fundraising approach allows public equity investors indirect exposure to Bitcoin. With growing adoption from firms like Microstrategy, Semler Scientific, and Metaplanet, bitcoin is emerging as a corporate treasury asset class.

BTC mining to be a $20bn industry: Bernstein. Russia legalises various crypto activities. Terra blockchain halted, Astro faces $6.8m exploit. Trump raised $21m at BTC conference.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 168 - SEC DROPS SOL CLAIMS
entry.summary: BTC falls to $66k after government moves $2bn BTC. Transfer most likely just a new custodian. SEC plans to drop charges SOL is a security. SOL ETF not happening in near term: BlackRock. ETFs to hit model portfolios later this year: BlackRock. Grayscale ETH ETF outflows slow marginally. Tron surpasses ETH & SOL for 24hr revenue. Pump(.)fun revenue beats ETH. BTC future tied to the elections: Jeffries. Polymarket hits $1bn betting volume. Polymarket integrates with Substack. Binance Labs announce 7th season of incubations. There is merit to Bitcoin and other coins: Elon. DeFi coins rise as MKR votes to share fees. COMP agrees to share fees with token holders.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 167 - CHATTING TO DOODLES!
entry.summary: BTC nears $70k after Trump speech, PoW alts soar. Crypto funds saw $245m inflows last week. Open Interest on BTC hits record $39.4bn. SOL overtakes ETH in several key metrics. Pump(.)fun overtakes ETH for daily revenue. Jito overtakes Lido for fees collected. $1.5bn altcoin unlocks in August, $600m XRP. Compound DAO faces $25m governance attack. JUP vote to reduce supply 30% is this week. JUP vote to reduce supply 30% is this week.

entry.title: New Technology Is Making Bionic Limbs More Affordable
entry.summary: Alt Bionics founder and CEO Ryan Saavedra talks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about the Genesis Hand, an affordable $5,000 bionic limb designed for daily use.

Minutes after launching Billyâ€™s dev abandoned him and sold the majority of their tokens. At the time, the tokens were worth $1,116 but at todayâ€™s value theyâ€™d be worth more than $8.65 million.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 166 - CRYPTO AND STOCKS FALL
entry.summary: BTC ETFs: +$44m, ETH ETFs: -$133m. ETH falls as Grayscale ETF outflows continue. ETH ETFs still see $1bn of daily volume. Liquidations hit $250m in sell-off. ETH Open Interest hits ATH at CME. BTC whales have bought $23bn in July. SOL weekly active addresses hits ATH. Bitstamp to distribute Mt. Gox BTC today. Russia to legalise crypto mining & payments. Lummis set to introduce BTC strategic reserve bill. Harris will not be at Bitcoin Nashville. BTC going to $52m by 2050: VanEck. Hashdex file for mixed BTC & ETH ETF. Coinbase to make tokenised treasuries fund. Polymarket partners with Moonpay for on-ramp. Ferrari accepts crypto in Europe. Bitfarms stopped in poison-pill strategy. Riot buys another miner for $93m.

Harris could be far more open to Bitcoin: Cuban. BTC symbol lights up Vegas Sphere. BlackRock applies for ENA cash allocation. Uber CEO wants to accept BTC.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 164 - ETH ETF DAY!

entry.title: What's the Meta? Do Crypto Degens Care About Being Scammed?
entry.summary: What's the Meta? With the rise of Pumpdotfun and rug pulls becoming a daily occurrence, why do crypto degens keep investing? Do these investors enjoy being scammed? It appears that people very often invest in meme coins that are very obviously going to rug pull. Once it happens, they just laugh it off on Twitter, is being scammed fun?!
